name: Extension
title: CS Extension
notes:
**Note 1**:  The nonperitonealized perimuscular tissue is, for jejunum and ileum, part of the mesentery and, for duodenum in areas where serosa is lacking, part of the interface with the pancreas.

**Note 2**:  Codes 100-200 take priority over code 300.  Code depth of invasion in preference to intraluminal spread or lateral extension to adjacent segment(s) of small intestine or cecum.

**Note 3**:  High-grade dysplasia is not always collected by cancer registries but, if collected, it should be coded 000.
